cards.name: Clockwork Beast
cards.text:
Clockwork Beast enters the battlefield with seven +1/+0 counters on it.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Beast attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast to be greater than seven. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

rulings.text: Loses a counter even if it is affected by a Fog-like effect which prevents it from dealing damage.
Can attack or block even if it has no counters.
This is a change from the most recent wording. Now, if some other spell or ability causes +1/+0 counters to be put on Clockwork Beast, it can wind up with more than seven such counters on it.

If Clockwork Beast has seven or fewer +1/+0 counters on it when its last ability resolves, it can wind up a maximum of seven such counters on it. If it has seven or more +1/+0 counters on it, the ability will have no effect.
Clockwork Beast's last ability resolves, you can choose to put fewer than X +1/+0 counters on it.

cards.originalText:
Clockwork Beast comes into play with seven +1/+0 counters on it.
Clockwork Beast can't have more than seven +1/+0 counters on it.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Beast attacked or blocked this turn, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast. Play this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Arc Lightning
cards.text: Arc Lightning deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three targets.
cards.flavor: Rainclouds don't last long in Shiv, but that doesn't stop the lightning.

rulings.text: You choose how many targets Arc Lightning has and how the damage is divided as you cast the spell. Each target must receive at least 1 damage.

If some of the creatures are illegal targets as Arc Lightning tries to resolve, the original division of damage still applies but no damage is dealt to the illegal targets. If all targets are illegal, Arc Lightning doesn't resolve.

cards.originalText: Arc Lightning deals 3 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.

rulings.text: If the creature leaves the battlefield before this resolves, it still damages the player.

cards.originalText: Shower of Sparks deals 1 damage to target creature and 1 damage to target player.

cards.name: Prodigal Sorcerer

cards.text:
Choose one â€”
â€¢ Target player gains 3 life.

cards.name: Infantry Veteran
cards.text: {T}: Target attacking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The true dishonor for a soldier is surviving the war."
â€”Telim'Tor

rulings.text: An "attacking creature" is one that has been declared as an attacker this combat, or one that was put onto the battlefield attacking this combat. Unless that creature leaves combat, it continues to be an attacking creature through the end of combat step, even if the player it was attacking has left the game, or the planeswalker it was attacking has left combat.

cards.originalText: {T}: Target attacking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Soul Warden
cards.text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
Count carefully the souls and see that none are lost.
â€”Vec teaching

rulings.text: Does not trigger on a card on the battlefield being changed into a creature.
The ability will not trigger on itself entering the battlefield, but it will trigger on any other creature that is put onto the battlefield at the same time.
Two Soul Wardens entering the battlefield at the same time will each cause the other's ability to trigger.
The life gain is mandatory.

cards.originalText: Whenever another creature comes into play, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Disenchant
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor:
"I implore you not to forget the horrors of the past. You would have us start the Brothers' War anew"
â€”Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi heretic

rulings.text: This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.flavor: The true names of birds are songs woven into their souls.

cards.name: Windfall
cards.text: Each player discards their hand, then draws cards equal to the greatest number of cards a player discarded this way.
cards.flavor:
"To fill your mind with knowledge, we must start by emptying it."
â€”Barrin, master wizard
cards.originalText: Each player discards his or her hand and draws cards equal to the greatest number a player discarded this way.

cards.name: Curfew
cards.text: Each player returns a creature they control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: ". . . But I'm not tired!"
cards.originalText: Each player returns a creature he or she controls to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Man-o'-War
cards.text: When Man-o'-War enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"Beauty to the eye does not always translate to the touch."

rulings.text: If there are no other creatures on the battlefield when Man-o'-War enters the battlefield, its ability must target itself.

cards.originalText: When Man-o'-War comes into play, return target creature to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Control Magic
cards.text:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.

rulings.text: Gaining control of a creature doesn't cause you to gain control of any Auras or Equipment attached to it.

cards.originalText: You control enchanted creature.

cards.name: Ray of Command
cards.text: Untap target creature an opponent controls and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn. When you lose control of the creature, tap it.
cards.flavor: "Heel."

rulings.text: You may target an untapped creature with Ray of Command.

The creature returns to the opponent when the "until end of turn" effect wears off during the cleanup step. It taps during the Cleanup step (if it is not already tapped), so any abilities triggered off it tapping happen at that time.
You tap the creature when you lose control of it for any reason â€” because Ray of Command's effect ends, or because a spell or ability causes another player to gain control of it.

cards.originalText: Untap target creature an opponent controls and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn. (It may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)

cards.text: Destroy all lands or all creatures. Creatures destroyed this way can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: Radiant's eyes flashed. "Go, then," the angel spat at Serra, "and leave this world to those who truly care."

rulings.text: You choose land or creatures when the spell resolves.

cards.originalText: Destroy all creatures or all lands. Creatures destroyed this way can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Subversion
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, each opponent loses 1 life. You gain life equal to the life lost this way.
cards.flavor: Kerrick's corrupt domain swelled like a blister on Tolaria's skin.

rulings.text: This is loss of life, not damage. It can't be prevented.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, each opponent loses 1 life. You gain life equal to the life lost this way.

cards.name: Pestilence
cards.text:
At the beginning of the end step, if no creatures are on the battlefield, sacrifice Pestilence.
{B}: Pestilence deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

rulings.text: Each activation is considered a new damage effect. An activation can only be 1 point of damage.
Note that "until end of turn" effects wear off after "at the beginning of the end step" triggered abilities, so an artifact that animates until end of turn can keep this on the battlefield.

It will stay on the battlefield if there is a creature that is put into the graveyard during the end step. This is because this ability will not trigger at all if there is at least one creature on the battlefield as the end step begins.

cards.originalText:
At end of turn, if there are no creatures in play, sacrifice Pestilence.
{B}: Pestilence deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Sadistic Glee
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever a creature dies, put a +1/+1 counter on enchanted creature.
cards.flavor:
"First blood isn't as important as last blood."
â€”Gerrard of the Weatherlight
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature is put into a graveyard from play, put a +1/+1 counter on enchanted creature.

cards.name: Terror
cards.text: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.originalText: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Syphon Soul
cards.text: Syphon Soul deals 2 damage to each other player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.
cards.originalText: Syphon Soul deals 2 damage to each other player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.

cards.name: Exhume
cards.text: Each player puts a creature card from their graveyard onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"Deathâ€”an outmoded concept. We sleep, and we change."
â€”Sitrik, birth priest
cards.originalText: Each player puts a creature card from his or her graveyard into play.

cards.name: Dark Ritual
cards.text: Add {B}{B}{B}.
cards.originalText: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Living Death
cards.text: Each player exiles all creature cards from their graveyard, then sacrifices all creatures they control, then puts all cards they exiled this way onto the battlefield.

rulings.text: As Living Death resolves, all players exile their creature cards from graveyards at the same time. Then all players sacrifice all creatures they control at the same time. Then all players put all creatures they exiled onto the battlefield at the same time.

Only cards exiled by Living Death's first instruction are put onto the battlefield. If a replacement effect (such as that of Leyline of the Void) causes any of the sacrificed creatures to be exiled instead of put into a graveyard, those cards aren't returned to the battlefield.

cards.originalText: Set aside all creature cards in all graveyards. Then put each creature that's in play into its owner's graveyard. Then put each creature card set aside this way into play under its owner's control.

cards.name: Unnerve
cards.text: Each opponent discards two cards.
cards.flavor:
"If fear is the only tool you have left, then you'll never control me."
â€”Xantcha, to Gix

rulings.text: Players with less than 2 cards discard all they have.

cards.originalText: Each opponent discards two cards from his or her hand.

cards.name: Weakness
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -2/-1.
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets -2/-1.

cards.name: Rolling Thunder
cards.text: Rolling Thunder deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of targets.
cards.flavor: "Such rage," thought Vhati, gazing up at the thunderhead from the Predator. "It is Greven's mind manifest."

rulings.text: If X is greater than 0, you can't choose zero targets. You must choose between one and X targets. If X is 0, you can't choose any targets.
You choose how many targets Rolling Thunder has and how the damage is divided as you cast the spell. Each target must receive at least 1 damage.

If some, but not all, of the targets become illegal by the time Rolling Thunder tries to resolve, the original division of damage still applies, but no damage is dealt to illegal targets. If all the targets are illegal, the spell won't resolve.
If Rolling Thunder is copied, the copy will retain the original damage divsion. The spell or ability will likely allow you to choose new targets, but you can't change the way damage is divided.

cards.originalText: Rolling Thunder deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.

cards.name: Heat Ray
cards.text: Heat Ray deals X damage to target creature.
cards.flavor: It's not known whether the Thran built the device to forge their wonders or to defend them.
cards.originalText: Heat Ray deals X damage to target creature.

cards.name: Reanimate
cards.text: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. You lose life equal to its converted mana cost.
cards.flavor:
"You will learn to earn death."
â€”Volrath

rulings.text: You lose life equal to the converted mana cost of the card you're bringing back, so if you Reanimate Volrath's Shapeshifter, you lose three life, regardless of what the next card down is.

cards.originalText: Put target creature card from a graveyard into play under your control. You lose life equal to that creature's converted mana cost.

cards.name: Sewer Rats
cards.text: {B}, Pay 1 life: Sewer Rats gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability no more than three times each turn.

cards.name: Cackling Fiend
cards.text: When Cackling Fiend enters the battlefield, each opponent discards a card.
cards.flavor: Its windpipe is only the first to amplify its maddening laughter.

rulings.text: If the opponent has no cards in hand, this has no effect.

cards.originalText: When Cackling Fiend comes into play, each opponent discards a card from his or her hand.

cards.name: Sengir Vampire
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.

rulings.text: If Sengir Vampire deals nonlethal damage to a creature and then a different effect or damage source causes that creature to be put into a graveyard later in the turn, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger and it will get a +1/+1 counter.

Each time a creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, check whether Sengir Vampire had dealt any damage to it at any time during that turn. If so, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger. It doesn't matter who controlled the creature or whose graveyard it was put into.
If Sengir Vampire and a creature it dealt damage to are both put into a graveyard at the same time, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger, but it will do nothing when it resolves.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever a creature is put into a graveyard from play, if Sengir Vampire dealt damage to it this turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.

cards.name: Swords to Plowshares
cards.text: Exile target creature. Its controller gains life equal to its power.

rulings.text: The amount of life gained is equal to the power of the targeted creature as it last existed on the battlefield.
If the creature's power is negative, its controller doesn't lose or gain life.

cards.originalText: Remove target creature from the game. Its controller gains life equal to its power.
